title: Attachments to email from icloud to gmail not appearing in Thunderbird
content: I use Thunderbird as my email client for three different Gmail accounts. One of my contacts in one of these accounts regularly sends me Word documents as attachments from an icloud address. The only one affected is the one person using an icloud address.

title: CARTELLE ARCHIVIATE
content:
Buongiorno, purtroppo non riesco più a trovare una delle mie cartelle di posta in Thunderbird.

Se effettuo una ricerca per una specifica email, il programma la trova correttamente e riconosce che si trova all’interno della cartella KNOWK - INNOPROCESS. Tuttavia, tale cartella non è più visibile né tra le sottocartelle né in nessun’altra posizione.

È possibile recuperarla in qualche modo?

In allegato invio uno screenshot che mostra come Thunderbird individua le email contenute in quella cartella, anche se la cartella non è più presente nell’elenco.

Grazie in anticipo per il vostro supporto. Cordiali saluti
creator: cirocalabria35

title: Hyperlink werkt niet, slotje wel
content:
Niet een probleem, maar een vraag.

In een inkomende mail zit een hyperlink. Als ik in gmail (in een browser) daarop klikt, krijg ik een nieuwe tab in de browser met de pagina waar die link naar verwijst.

Thunderbird ziet die link ook, (als ik erover hover verandert de muis in een handje), maar als ik erop klik gebeurt er niets. Rechtsklik -> kopieer link kan wel, maar doet niets. Copy-paste buffer blijft leeg.

Ik heb dit lijstje doorgenomen, geen oorzaak gevonden.

Bij nadere inspectie zag ik rechtsboven het bericht een slotje en een mobieltje. Zie screenshot. Als ik daarop klik, opent de link wel direct in de browser, zowel bij klikken op het slotje als bij klikken op het mobieltje.

Ik kan ermee leven, maar wat is hier precies aan de hand? Disclaimer: ik gebruik Thunderbird sinds gisteren.
creator: rbli63

title: Thunderbird on Windows 11 not deleting messages older than X using POP3 with leave messages ... for at most
content: I have set Thunderbird Settings to delete messages from the server older than X. However, since switching to Windows 11 and setting up the client there, even though I have checked and set the boxes to leave messages on server and for at most 28 days (or 30), the messages are staying on the server for upwards of six months. In case it matters, my server is comcast.net pop3 995. Since I did not have this problem for more than fifteen years of using thunderbird, I am suspecting that there is a new bug somewhere.

title: Google calendar sync is not working
content:
That’s not a new bug for me, I’ve been dealing with this one for a few years new, across multiple PCs and Thunderbird installations: from time to time, some of my appointments disappear from Thunderbird calendar. Forcing a synchronization achieves nothing: the appointments are correctly available on google calendar and are missing from Thunderbird.

From time to time I need to unsubscribe from the google calendar, re-subscribe and for a few days everything is fine. Then appointments start to disappear again… rinse and repeat.

Now, I understand it’s impossible to point out what’s going with so little details, and in fact my question really is: what can I do on my side to identify the root cause of this? Are there error logs I can check or other clues that can help with that?
creator: rossi10

title: Lost edit function in New Message>Insert>Image>Choose File>Select Image File
content: Just migrated from W10 to W11, new computer, using Dell migration utility. Didn't get my Thunderbird content, so followed Mozilla's instructions to copy Thunderbird from old computer to media to new computer. Thunderbird seems to operate ok, BUT Want to insert an image in new email, in the Select Image File I could previously right click on an image, and from the popup menu select an option "Edit", with which I could resize and/or crop the image. It ain't there no more. (there are "Edit with Photos", "Edit with Paint" and "Edit with Clipchamp", but they don't do what I need) How do I get EDIT back?? I would really appreciate a solution.
